page.title: 17FARMS - GROVE HALL
page.content: Grove Hall Farm has a prize herd of pedigree South Devon cattle.It has taken them eight years to build up the herd of approximately one-hundred cows .The company started by buying cows in 1977 and have been building it up since.They have now owned the 100 acre farm for nineteen years and employ two workers.It is a pasture farm and they breed the cattle for beef and shows. They go to six shows a year.So far this year the manager has five shows and has won fifteen first prizes.They have,and use two tractors, one fork lift truck,a topper(a small mower for cutting the heads of weeds) ,a muck spreader,a loader and a muck loader. They don't make silage,but they do make hay to feed the cattle in Winter. They farm one-hundred and twenty-five acres twenty-five of which are buildings.
